main.name: Hollie Allington-Kay
main.description: Working in FinTech Bank, Development Lead for the LGBTQ+ Network, and coordinating British Sign Language Community at Monzo
main.bio: I am a determined person with strong empathetic, organisational and communication skills. I am currently employed at Monzo within the second line of defence as a Senior Operational Risk Manager - working primarily with Payments, Third Party Risk Management and Finance. I am critical of my own progress while consistently driving to learn more, most recently challenging myself to expand my technical knowledge in SQL, Python3 and React. I have completed both my CertIRM in Risk Management in Financial Services, and an  ICA certificate in AML (distinction). I was born in Northern Ireland but grew up travelling; spending the bulk of my childhood in Kenya, East Africa. Whilst travelling, I was able to widen my outlook on life, develop my cross-cultural competencies and adaptibility. This also developed a large passion for animal conservation and illegal wildlife trafficking.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: A driven graduate with a passion for learning and challenging myself.

education.description: Three years of study in Business Studies, with a professional placement year.
education.level one: Contemporary Business Analysis, Analysis of Business Data, Financial Communications, Organisational Behaviour,  Principles of Marketing, and Introduction to Business Law.
education.level two: Operations Management, Contemporary Issues for Business, Management Finance, Critical HR Management, Buyer Behaviour & Market Research.
education.level four: Crisis & Disaster Management, Strategic Management, Business Project Management, Dissertation (What if? An exploration into the ethical and market-based implications and benefits of a legal rhinoceros horn trade.)

education.description: Sociology (A), Drama and Theatre Studies (A), Photography (C).

work.title: Risk & Compliance Analyst
work.description: Describe work, special projects, notable achievements, what technologies you have been working with, and anything else that would be useful for an employer to know.

work.title: Financial Crime Specialist
work.description: Working on in-depth investigations, reports and internal risk assessments for JMLIT cases, including the recommendation of changes to  existing controls to detect and prevent potential future exposure to identified threats. Liaising with Fincrime Engineers to develop and improve internal tooling. Providing onboarding, training, coaching and supplying actionable feedback for Financial Crime specialists. Reviewing Transaction Monitoring flags & providing feedback on the rate of false positives to improve the accuracy of transaction monitoring rules. Communicating with other financial organisations regarding fraudulent transactions. Writing and reviewing Suspicious Activity Reports (SARs). Resolving internal escalations to the Fincrime team. Reviewing and completing Requests For Information (RFI) from Law Enforcement, to assist them in the provision of required information for their investigations in a timely manner.

skills.name: International Certification in Financial Services Risk Management - Completed January 2022
JPMC Experience in Software Engineering - Completed June 2020
